comment: Professor Spearman's lectures are very unclear and sometimes it seems like she doesn't know what she is talking about. We had to do 2 group "supply chain games." These games are extremely confusing and unclear as she does not explain properly what to do. It was like we were teaching ourselves what to do.
Just one wrong question will get you a B for a test. Her tests are about 12 questions and if you get 2 or 3 silly wrong answers, you are toasted.

She doesn't care about her online class so good luck if you're taking her online. Only a few assignments worth major chunks of your grade. The exams were nothing like the material in the powerpoints so there was nothing to study. She would take months to grade assignments... Im running out of characters to type to just dont waste your time with her

I dont recommend her. She only has about 8 assignments including 3 exams which each are worth 25% of your grade. The exams only have 10-11 questions and if you miss 2 or 3 your grade will be low. The questions have nothing to do with the PowerPoints and be prepared to read even though some of the answers are not in the textbook either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I have taken Professor Spearman for a few classes, but this semester was Operations Management for Engineers. There wasn't a lot of work, but when there was it was really simple to answer. I would suggest getting the book, but I found it unnecessary. The exams and quizzes were simple and the answers could be found in her lessons. Easy A.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: I love Professor Spearman, she genuinely just wants you to do good. Whenever you need clarification or if there is an technical issue she's quick to help. As long as you study and do the course materials this class is an easy A. When I take a course I will go out of my way for her to be my professor,

Unorganized, test on difficult material that she barely touched on. No idea what she thinks she teaching when it comes time to test, but it isn't what is on the test. Then going back through notes and her presentation it is still unclear how to do the problems. Be prepared to be confused. Bad teacher

Teaches like she's an asst.  Reads from the slides.  Doesn't interact with online students, even though she DEMANDS they attend all classes.  Cannot use the tech for the online students adequately.
